interactions: Click/tap to select a digit tile
Drag across a row to shift (drag to edge to slide multiple tiles if supported)

meta.core_mechanic: A 5x5 sliding-digit puzzle where the human picks a digit tile and slides it into an adjacent empty space; the AI may insert a neutral obstacle tile to block a spot on its turns. Deterministic, replayable gameplay with a decoupled UI.

rules.text: Clear, testable rule with input/output MUST be defined for each action.
AI MUST make a move within 2 seconds of its turn starting.
AI with difficulty 'easy' MUST use a simple rule-based heuristic for valid moves.
AI with difficulty 'medium' MUST use a moderate-depth search with deterministic evaluation.
AI with difficulty 'hard' MUST use an advanced algorithm with pruning and deterministic evaluation.

properties.grid: 2D array of cells with fields: occupantId|null, value (digit or null), type

actions.name: player_move
actions.result: Apply mechanics.move_validation and mechanics.capture; update state; switch to AI; check end conditions

actions.name: ai_move
actions.result: AI calculates move using algorithm; apply mechanics.move_validation and mechanics.capture; update state; switch to human; check end conditions

actions.name: restart
actions.result: Reset all state to initial values

setup.initial_placement: Digits 1-24 placed in row-major order with the bottom-right cell empty. The starting layout is fixed for determinism (see Row-major target).

capture.result: No capture occurs; tiles slide into the empty space only.

scoring.winner_determination: The human wins when the target row-major arrangement with an empty cell at bottom-right is achieved; otherwise, play continues. Tie-breaks follow move_count comparison.

turn_flow.extra_turn_conditions: end game after two consecutive passes

validity_checks: target cell must be the currently empty cell
selected tile must be a movable digit tile (not a neutral obstacle)
target must be adjacent to the selected tile

validation_algorithm.name: grid_slide_validation
steps: Return validity and a preview of resulting board state if valid

acceptance.then: Mechanics.validate and capture apply; state updates deterministically
acceptance.given: A valid placement/move exists per game rules

acceptance.then: AI uses simple algorithm and moves within 2 seconds
AI MUST execute a winning move if available
AI MUST block human's winning move if possible

win.check_logic: Board is in target row-major order with digits 1-24 placed left-to-right, top-to-bottom and the bottom-right cell empty.

draw.check_logic: If current player has no legal moves and both players pass consecutively, declare a draw.

lose.check_logic: If move_count exceeds a fixed threshold (e.g., 60 moves) and human win condition not yet achieved, AI is declared winner.
